0530/A0/06/001/005.status_value: Federal Laws on Social Protection and Protection of Families with Children were revised to ensure minimum equal benefits (4 out of 9) from the FBiH budget  however  they have not been adopted as of yet due to a number of constraints in 2014. Four by-laws regulating the children's social benefits were adopted in Republika Srpska. In Brcko District (BD)  the Social Protection and Inclusion Action Plan was adopted and budgeted  as an integral part of the Brcko District Social Inclusion Strategy. In
0530/A0/06/001/005.indicator_name: Social and child protection legislation amended to harmonize and increase benefits for the most vulnerable
0530/A0/06/001/005.baseline_value: Draft new Federal Laws on Social and Child Protection from 2008

0530/A0/06/001/005.status_value: 23 municipalities had an increase in budget allocations for SPI (ranging from 8-13% on average). However  new legal provisions with reference to social benefits have consequently led to increase of overall budget allocations in RS in all Municipalities. New budget allocations at local level are proposed in support of new 5 SPI Action Plans in Birac region.
0530/A0/06/001/005.indicator_name: # of municipalities that have reallocated and/or increased budget allocations for social protection and inclusion programmes for children

0530/A0/06/001/005.status_value: 42 municipalities established permanent SPI Commissions (11 under the MDG-F DEG programme  18 under the SPIS project  with two merged commission in joint Municipalities  5 in Birac region and 10 under Annex 7 joint project). 39 municipalities developed and adopted SPI Action Plans (13 under the DEG programme  21 under the SPIS project and 5 under Birac).
0530/A0/06/001/005.indicator_name: # of municipalities that have established SPI Commissions and adopted Action Plans
Entity and Brcko District Laws on Social Protection harmonized in supporting the vulnerable and children with disabilities and linked with budgetary planning processes. Yes/no

0530/A0/06/002/006.status_value: 33 municipalities. UNICEF keeps providing technical support to municipal authorities and service providers at the local level to develop or strengthen referral mechanisms. This entails capacity development of social workers  health and educational professionals  and police officers  in their ability to identify  refer and address cases of violence against children.
0530/A0/06/002/006.indicator_name: % of municipalities referring children through a continuum of protection services

0530/A0/06/002/006.status_value: 9 municipalities (Justice for Children project locations) have established conditions for provision of community-based alternative measures to detention. The second phase of the Project (2014 ¿ 2017) will support 7 new municipalities (initially planned 10). The late adoption of the FBiH Juvenile Justice Law (Dec. 2013) has been a bottleneck for the application of alternative measures in this entity. The FBiH law will be in foce as of Feb 2015.
0530/A0/06/002/006.indicator_name: % of municipalities providing community-based alternative measures to detention  based on a revised normative framework (at entity level)  in line with international standards

0530/A0/06/002/006.status_value: 1 child placed in alternative care vs. 1.75 child placed in institutions (no changes in data yet). Between 2010 and 2012  entities made steps forward in revising laws and policies. However  intensified efforts are needed to implement policies and reduce the number of children in institutions. UNICEF supported both entities with capacity development and concrete initiatives to strengthen the prevention system  and promote alternative to institutions.
0530/A0/06/002/006.indicator_name: in selected locations  the ratio of children placed in alternative  family- based care to children placed in institutions
0530/A0/06/002/006.baseline_value: To be established. Policy framework on children without parental care exists (2008 for FBiH and 2009 for RS) and is not implemented yet

0530/A0/06/002/006.indicator_name: Percentage of municipalities with child friendly procedures in place (either in courts  prosecutors' offices and/or police rooms)

0530/A0/06/002/001.status_value: 68% immunization coverage in BiH and only 1.5% for Roma (MICS4  2012)
0530/A0/06/002/001.baseline_value: Immunization coverage rate (61.2% as per MICS3)  Health communication KAP

0530/A0/06/002/001.status_value: The public health system developed a nutrition-friendly kindergarten initiative  which is being introduced in both entities. Initial activities have been started in 6 kindergartens in RS and in 6 kindergartens in FBIH.
0530/A0/06/002/001.indicator_name: Health systems have developed and introduced programmes for prevention of malnutrition among children to decrease macronutrients deficiencies and reduce anaemia among children and pregnant women

0530/A0/07/002/003.status_value: Both  RS and FBiH  have relevant strategies compliant with the UN Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children
0530/A0/07/002/003.indicator_name: (DEACTIVATED Jan 1 2017) An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country
0530/A0/07/002/003.headline: UNICEF and partners strengthened the justice for children system through the generation of new evidence on children's access to justice  development of justice for children action plans in 27 municipalities  and capacity development of over 440 professionals working with children in contact with the law.
0530/A0/07/002/003.target_value: Policies reviewed through a thorough assessment

0530/A0/07/002/003.status_value: Action plans were developed in 16 project locations (covering in total 27 municipalities)
0530/A0/07/002/003.indicator_name: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms
0530/A0/07/002/003.headline: UNICEF and partners strengthened the justice for children system through the generation of new evidence on children's access to justice  development of justice for children action plans in 27 municipalities  and capacity development of over 440 professionals working with children in contact with the law.

0530/A0/06/001/006.status_value: Children and young people in 39 municipalities effectively influenced planning for the most vulnerable and excluded children  through the initiatives ¿Take us seriously-It's about Ability ¿ which resulted in projects designed and implemented by children  and supported by the local authorities.
0530/A0/06/001/006.indicator_name: # of municipalities and Ministries that suport communication for development initiatives for children

0530/A0/06/001/006.status_value: 39 municipalities (24 under the MDG-F DEG and SPIS project  with two merged commission in joint Municipalities  5 in Birac region and 10 under Annex 7 joint project) supported initiatives related to child participation and communication for development (C4D)  by hosting focus groups  presentations  workshops  debates and round tables. Five Entity level ministries and three State level ministries supported C4D initiatives within the SPIS Project and It's about ability Campaign.
0530/A0/06/001/006.indicator_name: # of municipalities where children and young people are effectively influencing planning for the most vulnerable and excluded children

0530/A0/07/003/004.status_value: Completed and exceeded the target. Total 7121 children and youth from 113 primary and secondary schools from 71 communities in BiH reached with intercultural activities.
0530/A0/07/003/004.indicator_name: # of children and adolescents reached through intercultural initiatives
0530/A0/07/003/004.headline: The evaluation of the UNICEF component on intercultural education  part of the `Dialogue for the Future' UN Joint Programme  noted a positive overall change of 15 per cent in attitudes among children towards life in a multicultural society. Greatest progress was noted in the most disadvantaged canton in FBiH.

0530/A0/07/003/004.status_value: Fully achieved  Platform established and three Conferences held.
0530/A0/07/003/004.indicator_name: MoU for Dialogue Platform signed and ToR or equivalent document approved
0530/A0/07/003/004.headline: The evaluation of the UNICEF component on intercultural education  part of the `Dialogue for the Future' UN Joint Programme  noted a positive overall change of 15 per cent in attitudes among children towards life in a multicultural society. Greatest progress was noted in the most disadvantaged canton in FBiH.

0530/A0/07/003/001.status_value: Final draft of the Preschool Strategy for BiH is developed.
0530/A0/07/003/001.indicator_name: Preschool Strategy for BiH submitted for adoption to the Council of Ministers
0530/A0/07/003/001.headline: The Preschool Strategy for BiH was developed in 2016  and is awaiting endorsement. Advocacy and modelling work over three years on expanding access to preschool education resulted in 70 per cent of children aged 3-5 in the most disadvantaged canton in FBiH (Canton 10) benefiting from free preschool education

0530/A0/07/003/001.status_value: On track. Four municipal projects developed and started implementation.
0530/A0/07/003/001.indicator_name: Sustainable municipal model for increased preschool enrolment with focus on Roma inclusion developed
0530/A0/07/003/001.headline: The Preschool Strategy for BiH was developed in 2016  and is awaiting endorsement. Advocacy and modelling work over three years on expanding access to preschool education resulted in 70 per cent of children aged 3-5 in the most disadvantaged canton in FBiH (Canton 10) benefiting from free preschool education

0530/A0/07/003/001.status_value: Completed in 2015. 23 preschool institutions have been refurbished and equipped with didactic materials  sports equipment and furniture.
0530/A0/07/003/001.indicator_name: No of preschool institutions with capacity to work on ECI

Advocacy and modelling work over three years on expanding access to preschool education resulted in 70 per cent of children aged 3-5 in the most disadvantaged canton in FBiH (Canton 10) benefiting from free preschool education

0530/A0/06/001/004.status_value: BiH Agency for Statistics in close cooperation with the entity statistics and Brcko District revised social protection forms for collection of data  supported the development of the Child Poverty Analysis  developed a Country Analytical Report based on the Transmonee data  and continued to strengthen its capacity and skills in the field of the social statistics (European System of Social Protection Statistics-ESSPROS).
0530/A0/06/001/004.indicator_name: Statistical agencies at all levels and Ministries provide updated and disaggregated data on the situation of children and young people  in line with the EU statistical framework and national strategies
0530/A0/06/001/004.baseline_value: MICS 3 data available  HBS with extended EU SILC module in 2009

0530/A0/06/001/004.status_value: 42 municipalities (13 DEG  21 SPIS (2 overlapping)  10 with CRC network created by NGO Nasa djeca).
0530/A0/06/001/004.indicator_name: # of municipalities where civil society organisations and groups of children and young people regularly monitor and report on child rights.
0530/A0/06/001/004.baseline_value: in 10 municipalities  Participatory Action Research groups of children monitor and report on child rights.

0530/A0/06/001/004.status_value: 6 State level ministries and agencies  13 entity level ministries and agencies  23 cantonal level ministries and agencies submitted data to two state level ministries (MHRR and MoCA). MHRR developed a first Report founded on the Guidelines for Identification of Socially Excluded Children in BIH in 2014 and publicly presented and disseminated the Report. Although  the Guidelines for improving the position of the Roma Children in BiH were adopted the Report was not developed in 2014. However  the
0530/A0/06/001/004.indicator_name: # of ministries that regularly report on the situation of vulnerable children to inform inter-sectoral policies and programmes on social inclusion and protection.
0530/A0/06/001/004.baseline_value: 0 (Ad hoc or periodic reports are available but there is no national consensus and unified methodology to report on situation of children in 2009)

0530/A0/07/003/002.indicator_name: No of school trained on IE by 14 model schools
0530/A0/07/003/002.headline: UNICEF BiH trained 120 teachers and school professionals from 14 schools as trainers on inclusive education and completed a baseline study on teacher capacity on Inclusive Education (IE). UNICEF supported the country's efforts to get ready to participate in the Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA) 2018.
